poem:
**Agony Over the Wire**

Her voice quivers
through miles of silence,
grip furiously knuckles white,
a daughter's scream
fractures the morning -
I cannot reach 
across agony,
cannot hold the unseen hand
consumed by fire,
only the echo
of helplessness
lives between us.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war live: Israel’s use of heavy bombs raises ‘serious concerns’ under laws of war 1.48pm BST AFP has a report on the UN Human Rights Council on Wednesday: Her voice shaking with emotion, Meirav Leshem Gonen described to the UN Human Rights Council Wednesday the agony of listening over the phone as Hamas militants seized her daughter on October 7. Her daughter, 23-year-old Romi Gonen, “was terrified, and I felt utterly helpless as I". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
